page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT
page.content: When our teacher attended Gressenhall School in the 1940's, most of the children's fathers were involved with work on the land and none were unemployed. Now because of increased mechanisation on farms very few now have work connected with the land although this is still a rural area.In a survey taken from 67 children we discovered that most of our fathers are connected with the building trade.This is not surprising as Norfolk is one of the fastest growing areas in the country and the villages of Beetley and Gressenhall are expanding.There are two local building firms R.Duffield of Gressenhall and E.Melton & Sons of Beetley.
